content.description: SDS on the lowest part of the arete and climb up till mantle
content.location: On the Counselor Boulder. The smaller face that looks like a triangle

content.description:
A truly unique climb for the area, more reminiscent of Joshua Tree or an offwidth climber's basement. Start matched on the farthest right corner of the low crevice. Use any number of knee bars, heel toe cams, and toe hooks to work your way down and across, eventually topping out at the left arete.

All parts of the boulder are "on."
content.location: Directly downhill from the Counselor boulder.

content.description:
Start on the lower right and traverse using face holds. Grunty up problems under each jug are possible as well. A beautiful setting and a good warmup, literally, as it catches sun until late afternoon. Good if you get cold in the shade of the Irish boulders.

The name is a nod to Alex's neoclassic route "

Three's Company

" up on the hill.
content.protection: A pad is useful for the rock on the other side of the coyote den.
content.location: I built and used a trail from Song of the Iron Horse that attached to a small game trail leading south, but that has fallen out of use as the development of the Road to Zion area came about. It's now much easier to walk over to that cluster then straight down from the start jugs of AotCR. Climbing up on ledges out of a cave near here is Mike's Secret Boulder Problem V0, creepy!

content.description: Stand start on the left part of the slab and move your way up the left part of the face.
content.location: To the left of The Counselor on the same boulder.

content.description:
Sit start on the right of the overhung face with a ledge.  Toss to the pocket above you then immediately make moves across the face towards the rail. Two tension moves lead to jugs and the top. The top moves are still a bit dirty, be careful after rocking up.

youtube.com/watch?v=yiVQpFU…
content.protection: Pad and spotters. Potential exists to roll down the hill without a spotter. Keep a low profile at these boulders - climbers are visible from the freeway down below. Pack it in Pack it out.
content.location: I built and used a trail from Song of the Iron Horse that attached to a small game trail leading south, but that has fallen out of use as the development of the Road to Zion area came about. It's now much easier to walk over to that cluster then straight down from the start jugs of AotCR

content.description:
How do you grade the difficulty of a single move? This question, long debated by climbers, is truly exemplified by this problem.

Match the flat underclinging edge, smear feet, stand up. Desperately grab a jug, bust two "hardly even a move it's so easy" moves, and top out. Don't dab.

​

SDS on the far right part of the face and traverse till overhang and mantle out of that. Don’t dab
content.location: If your facing The Counselor boulder it’s 35 yards to the right of it.

content.description: Sit start matched in the massive pocket and immediately head up.
content.location: The small boulder immediately next to the Counselor boulder. Approximately four feet from the start of Warriors in the Garden.

content.description: From a sit start on a good ledge, climb the slab immediately left of Gose On Gear, topping out direct. Big feet, small hands.
content.location: Immediately left (3-4 feet) of Gose On Gear. Several hundred yards right of the Counselor and Little Prow boulders.

content.description: Stand start at the base of the flaring crack and use any manner of techniques (layback, jamming, whatever) to climb the easy face.
content.location: Several hundred feet right and slightly uphill of the Counselor boulder. Best approached by continuing past the descent to the Counselor until you reach a natural decline in the hill that trends back to the base of the boulder.

content.description: SDS on the biggest pocket with a right hand and the left on the undercling above the nice volume feature. begin up the over hang and exit out right towards the large hueco near the top of the climb.
content.location: On the same boulder as Three Wise Men, directly behind it.

content.description: Stand start on the juggy crack system in the middle of the slab face
content.location: The Freeway side. The gully north of Ireland. Near the top of the ridge.

content.description:
MST Classic...

SDS on the big lowest huecos doubled up. Go up and exit left.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter. The landing is on a slope.
